patterns: what are the symptoms of hyperthyroidism
responses:
In hyperthyroidism, your thyroid gland is overactive. It produces too much thyroid hormone. This can cause many of your body's functions to speed up.Symptoms are:
restlessness
nervousness
racing heart rate
irritability
increased sweating
shaking
anxiety
trouble sleeping
thin skin
brittle hair and nails
Muscle weakness
weight loss

patterns: what are the symptoms of hypothyroidism
responses:
Hypothyroidism is the opposite of hyperthyroidism. Your thyroid gland is underactive and can't produce enough of its hormones. This can cause some of your body's functions to slow down.Symptoms are:
Fatigue
Dry skin and hair
Increased sensitivity to cold temperatures
Memory problems
Constipation
Depression
Weight gain
Weakness or muscle and joint pain
Slow heart rate
Heavy and irregular menstruation
Fertility problems.

The normal range of TSH levels in adults is between 0.4 to 4.0 mIU/L (milli-international units per liter). Some research suggests that this range should actually be more like 0.45 to 2.5 mIU/L.

patterns: What causes thyroid problems in females?
Why Women Are More Prone to Thyroid Problems?
why females are affected by thyroid
responses:
One reason for this is that thyroid disorders are often triggered by autoimmune responses, which happen when the bodyâ€™s immune system starts to attack its own cells. 
Another reason for the prevalence of thyroid disorders in women is that there is an interplay between thyroid hormones and the hormones that fluctuate during the menstrual cycle. Thyroid problems can happen at any time but they are especially common in women during and after the menopause when hormone levels are changing. Some women may confuse the symptoms of thyroid disorders with the effects of the menopause, which can prevent them from seeking treatment.
